top_categories.workout_context: Rasputitsa Spring Classic's Vermont mountains, Spring mud season forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 60 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Rasputitsa Spring Classic's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before March.
83ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Rasputitsa Spring Classic, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
60 miles on Vermont mountainous gravel with spring mud burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Rasputitsa Spring Classic, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rasputitsa Spring Classic. Train it until it feels boring.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Vermont mountainous gravel with spring mud. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Smooth pedaling at 60 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Low-cadence force work for 5,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Rasputitsa Spring Classic’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Rasputitsa Spring Classic demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride vermont mountainous gravel with spring mud at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: vermont mountains, spring mud season, mountainous gravel. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 60 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 60 miles of vermont mountainous gravel with spring mud in Burke, Vermont.
